intro: Cyphostemma pruriens, commonly known as the itching bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces yellow, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. The leaves are simple and alternate, with a rough texture that can cause an itchy sensation when touched.
